sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: A cube has a volume of 64 cubic units. What is the volume of the sphere inscribed in the cube? (Round your answer to the nearest hundredth)
message_2:
A cube with a volume of 64 cubic units has a side length of 4 units (since 4^3 = 64). The diameter of the inscribed sphere is equal to the side length of the cube, so the diameter of the sphere is 4 units. Therefore, the radius of the sphere is 2 units.

The volume of a sphere is given by the formula V = (4/3)πr^3, where V is the volume and r is the radius. Plugging in the radius of 2 units, we get:

V = (4/3)π(2^3)
V = (4/3)π(8)
V = 32π/3

Rounding to the nearest hundredth, the volume of the inscribed sphere is approximately 33.51 cubic units.
